resources.string:
Average starting salary for an IT professional
in US is $100,000
You haven\'t logged in. Please login to enjoy selecting your own indicators.

By selecting Annual Median Wage, you will see the annual median income of Computer Programmers of your selected states. 
 The source of data is from U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (SOC code 151251). 
 
 By selecting Healthcare Ranking, you will see the overall ranking of the Best Health Care Systems of your selected states. This ranking evaluates health care systems from 3 aspects: 
 (1) Cost; (2) Access; and (3) Outcomes.
 The source of data is from Wallethub.

By selecting Happiness Ranking, you will see the overall ranking of the Happiest States of your selected states in the U.S. This ranking evaluates happiness from 3 aspects: 
 (1) Emotion and Physical Well-Being; (2) Work Environment; and (3) Community and Environment. The source of data is from Wallethub. 
 
 By selecting Air and Water Quality, you will see the Best States for Natural Environment Ranking of your selected states. This ranking evaluates the natural environment from 2 aspects: 
 (1) The number of days with an air quality index above a healthy threshold; and (2) the number of violation points against drinking water systems in each state.
 The source of data is from US News.

By selecting State Income Tax Rate, you will see the State Individual Income Tax Rates for 2022 of your selected states. 
 The source of data is from Tax Foundation. 
 
 By selecting Education Rankings, you will see the Best States for Education Rankings of your selected states. This ranking evaluates the education from 2 aspects: 
 (1) The higher education ranking, which tracks educational attainment, graduation rates, college debt and tuition costs; and (2) Pre-K - 12 ranking, which measures enrollment in pre-K, standardized test scores and the public high school graduation rate.
 The source of data is from US News.

By selecting Safety Ranking, you will see the Safest State Rankings of your selected states. 
 The source of data is from XXX. 
 
 By selecting Cost of Living Index, you will see the Cost of Living Index by State in 2022 of your selected states. It is defined as the amount of money needed to sustain a certain standard of living by affording basic needs such as housing, food, healthcare, and more. The cost of living is often used to compare how expensive it is to live in one location compared to another and is also used as a big factor for people to determine where they want to be located in addition to cultural attractions, the job market, and other factors. 
 The source of data is from World Population Review and Statista.

By selecting Entertainment, Recreation and Nightlife Ranking, you will see the Funniest State Rankings of your selected states. 
 The source of data is from Wallethub. 
 
 By selecting Average House Cost, you will see the how much the Average House Costs in your selected states.
 The source of data is from Reader's Digest.
